{"step_by_step_thinking": "The most commonly missing primary teeth are not the central incisors, either maxillary or mandibular, as these are usually the first to erupt and are rarely missing. The maxillary canines are also not commonly missing. The maxillary lateral incisors are the most commonly missing primary teeth, often due to genetic factors or space issues in the mouth.", "answer_choice": "C. Maxillary lateral incisors"}
